description: Borrowed from Creole French ratafia, from the Latin phrase rata fiat (conventio) (“the deal is made”), a drinking toast expression to celebrate a deal or an agreement.  Or, sharing an Arabic origin with arak.

entries.meaning: A liqueur or cordial flavored with peach or cherry kernels, bitter almonds, or other fruits.
(countable) A kind of biscuit made with ratafia essence and almond or apricot kernels.
